reasons_to_visit.details: Traditional Czech Easter markets in the Great Square feature hand-painted eggs, local crafts, and seasonal treats like mazanec (Easter bread).
Beautiful spring flowers begin blooming in the city's main gardens, creating colorful displays and perfect photography opportunities.
Mild temperatures (8-15°C) and increasing sunshine make April ideal for walking the historic center and exploring the White Tower.
Museums and cultural venues reopen with special spring exhibitions, and the university district becomes more vibrant with student activities.
Fewer crowds than summer while still enjoying good weather, making it easier to visit attractions like the East Bohemian Museum.

reasons_to_avoid.details: April weather can be unpredictable with occasional rain showers and temperature fluctuations requiring flexible outdoor planning.
Some attractions and restaurants may have limited hours during Easter weekend, especially on Easter Sunday.
Accommodation and dining prices start rising as tourist season approaches, though still more affordable than summer.

activities: Easter market shopping in Great Square
Spring garden walks in Jirásek Gardens
White Tower climb for city views

special_events.description: Traditional Czech Easter markets with hand-painted eggs, local crafts, and seasonal treats
Special spring-themed exhibitions showcasing local history and culture
Student performances and cultural events as academic year progresses

local_tips: Visit Easter markets early morning for the best selection of traditional Czech Easter decorations
Climb the White Tower on clear days for the best spring views of the city
Bring layers and rain gear for unpredictable April weather
Book restaurants in advance during Easter weekend
Explore Jirásek Gardens in the afternoon for the best spring flower photography
